item.title: Antenna：Netflixの6.99ドルの広告ティアの3月の米国加入者数は937,616人（～55M）、Netflixの数週間後に開始したDisney+の広告ティアは863,791人（Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Antenna: Netflix's $6.99 ad tier had 937,616 US subscribers in March, out of ~55M total, and Disney+'s ad tier, launched a few weeks after Netflix, had 863,791  —  Streaming leader had fewer than one million U.S. subscribers on its ad-supported plan as of March

item.title: ニューヨークの控訴裁判所が、ABCニュースの元幹部マイケル・コーンに対する性的暴行訴訟の一部を復活、下級審は2022年に訴えを却下（Joe Flint/Wall Street Journal)
item.description:
Joe Flint / Wall Street Journal:
A New York appeals court reinstates parts of a sexual assault lawsuit against former ABC News executive Michael Corn; a lower court dismissed the suit in 2022  —  Michael Corn, who left ABC News in 2021, has denied the allegations  —  A New York appeals court reinstated parts …

item.title: NYT、プライベートベータで〜1.5年ぶりにiOSでNew York Times Audioを開始、短編ストーリーやThe Headlinesという日替わりニュース番組など（Charlotte Klein/Vanity Fair）
item.description:
Charlotte Klein / Vanity Fair:
The NYT launches New York Times Audio on iOS after ~1.5 years in private beta, with short-form stories, a daily news show called The Headlines, and more  —  While the rest of the audio industry craters, the Gray Lady debuts a one-stop app for subscribers, with new short-form stories and an even shorter daily morning podcast.

item.title: BBC NewsがBBC Verifyを発表、ジャーナリストの仕事について「幕を引き」「過激な透明性」を提供、OSINTなどから60人のチームを結成（Bron Maher/Press Gazette)
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
BBC News announces BBC Verify to “pull back the curtain” and offer “radical transparency” on its journalists' work, with a team of 60 from OSINT and elsewhere  —  BBC News chief executive Deborah Turness said BBC Verify would “pull back the curtain”.

item.title: WGA交渉委員会は電子メールで、自分たちの提案は、ディズニーに75Mドル、ネットフリックスに68Mドル、WBDに47Mドルなど、年間推定429Mドルかかるとしている（Gene Maddaus/Variety)
item.description:
Gene Maddaus / Variety:
In an email, the WGA negotiating committee says its proposals would cost an estimated $429M per year, including $75M to Disney, $68M to Netflix, and $47M to WBD  —  The Writers Guild of America argued Tuesday that the strike will end up costing studios more if it goes on for “weeks and months” …

item.title: あるTVライターが、自分のキャリアパス、散発的な収入、副業、経費について説明し、なぜ今フードスタンプなのか、なぜWGAのストライキが必要なのかを説明する（Jeanie Bergen/The Cut）。
item.description:
Jeanie Bergen / The Cut:
A TV writer describes her career path, sporadic income, side gigs, and expenses to explain why she is on food stamps now and why the WGA strike is necessary  —  Sign up here.  —  I was working as a cater waiter when I sold my first TV show.  One evening, while working a party, I ran into someone I knew in college.

item.title: メモ：NYSEがAudacyの取引を停止し、低価格のため上場廃止の手続きを開始すると伝え、Audacyは上訴する予定で、株式はOTC取引される（インサイドラジオ）
item.description:
Inside Radio:
Memo: the NYSE halts trading in Audacy and tells the company it will begin delisting steps due to low price; Audacy plans to appeal, and shares will trade OTC  —  Trading of Audacy's stock was abruptly halted shortly after 2pm today on the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: 100人以上のジャーナリストや編集者が、香港に元Apple Daily発行人のジミー・ライの釈放を求める書簡に署名、彼は英国の弁護士を使うことを阻止されている（Amy Hawkins/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Amy Hawkins / The Guardian:
Over 100 journalists and editors sign a letter calling for Hong Kong to release former Apple Daily publisher Jimmy Lai; he's been blocked from using a UK lawyer  —  Leading global media figures among signatories backing publisher, hit with wave of ‘lawfare’ including legislation to stop him hiring UK barrister

item.title: RumbleがポッドキャスティングとライブストリーミングサービスのCallinを買収、元PayPal COOでCallinの共同設立者David SacksがRumbleの取締役会に参加予定（Bill Peters/MarketWatch)
item.description:
Bill Peters / MarketWatch:
Rumble acquires podcasting and livestreaming service Callin; former PayPal COO and Callin's co-founder David Sacks plans to join Rumble's board of directors  —  'I strongly support Rumble's unwavering commitment to free speech in the face of growing censorship and government overreach …

item.title: The Messengerのコンテンツを分析すると、英国のタブロイド紙のような記事と、圧倒的に男性が多い傍線（Joshua Benton/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Joshua Benton / Nieman Lab:
A quick analysis of The Messenger's content shows an outlet with stories that resemble those from a British tabloid and bylines apparently overwhelmingly male  —  The new site from the former owner of The Hill — backed by $50 million — feels like a remnant of an earlier age.  —  command-f, c, a, r, r, o, l, l.

item.title: 元NFLパンターのパット・マカフィーが4年間$120M FanDuelとの契約を破棄し、番組をESPN、ESPN+、ESPNのYouTubeチャンネルに移し、秋にスタートする予定（Andrew Marchand/New York Post)
item.description:
Andrew Marchand / New York Post:
Former NFL punter Pat McAfee breaks his four-year $120M FanDuel contract to move his show to ESPN, ESPN+, and ESPN's YouTube channel, set to start in the fall  —  “The Pat McAfee Show” is moving to ESPN in a multimillion-dollar deal that he is expected to begin in the fall, The Post has learned.

item.title: Dotdash Meredith、ウェブサイトから収集した匿名化されたユーザーデータの集合体に基づいて広告主がユーザーをターゲットにできるクッキーレス広告ツール「D/Cipher」をデビュー（Sara Fischer/Axios）。
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Dotdash Meredith debuts D/Cipher, a cookie-less ad tool that lets advertisers target users based on aggregate, anonymized user data collected from its websites  —  Dotdash Meredith, one of the largest internet publishers in the country, will debut a new ad targeting tool called D/Cipher …

item.title: 35年以上の経験を持つNPRの外国人記者3人が、女性特派員であること、国際報道はどう変わったか、などについてQ&Aを発表（Sitara Nieves/Poynter)
item.description:
Sitara Nieves / Poynter:
Q&A with three departing NPR foreign reporters with 35+ years of experience, on being female correspondents, how international reporting has changed, and more  —  Women correspondents with a combined 114 years of experience depart after recent budget cuts

item.title: Tencent Music、第1四半期の売上高は前年同期比5.4％増の〜10.2億ドル、音楽配信の売上高は同30.4％増の〜3.78億ドル、加入者数は同17.7％増の94.4万人 (Elizabeth Dilts Marshall/Billboard)
item.description:
Elizabeth Dilts Marshall / Billboard:
Tencent Music reports Q1 revenue up 5.4% YoY to ~$1.02B, revenue from music subscriptions up 30.4% YoY to ~$378M, and subscribers up 17.7% YoY to 94.4M  —  China's leading music streaming company reports a 34% increase in revenue from music subscriptions.  —  China's Tencent Music Entertainment Group …

item.title: CNETの従業員は、WGA Eastで〜100人のライター、編集者、その他のコンテンツクリエーターを代表する組合を結成し、経営陣に任意承認を求める（Josh Eidelson/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Josh Eidelson / Bloomberg:
CNET employees seek to form a union representing ~100 writers, editors, and other content creators with WGA East and ask management for voluntary recognition  —  CNET journalists are pushing to unionize, seeking a formal say on issues including the use of artificial intelligence at the technology-news company.
